messages.content: anytrans says "Loading device data, please wait..." - why how can i get the backup done

When AnyTrans is stuck on **‚ÄúLoading device data, please wait‚Ä¶‚Äù**, it usually means it's having trouble communicating with your iPhone. This is commonly caused by:

---

### üîß **Common Causes & Fixes**
| Problem | Explanation | Fix |
|--------|-------------|-----|
| **Trust Not Established** | iPhone hasn‚Äôt been trusted on the computer | Unplug ‚Üí Unlock iPhone ‚Üí Plug in again ‚Üí Tap ‚ÄúTrust‚Äù on iPhone |
| **Outdated iTunes/Driver** | AnyTrans relies on Apple drivers from iTunes | Install/update [latest iTunes](https://support.apple.com/downloads/itunes) (even on macOS) |
| **Faulty Cable/Port** | USB issues can cause slow reads or hangs | Try another USB cable/port, avoid USB hubs |
| **Device Locked / Screen Off** | Locked screen can block access | Make sure screen is on and unlocked the whole time |
| **Permission Glitch** | Sometimes macOS blocks full access | Go to `System Settings ‚Üí Privacy & Security ‚Üí Full Disk Access`, and **add AnyTrans** |
| **Device Backup Already In Progress** | macOS/iTunes could be backing up in parallel | Quit iTunes and Finder while using AnyTrans |
| **Low Disk Space on Target Drive** | Especially relevant for custom backup locations | Make sure `/Volumes/Descent/` has enough free space |

---

### ‚úÖ **Extra Step for Your Setup**
Since you've already **linked `~/Library/Application Support/MobileSync/Backup` to your external drive**, make sure:

1. The external drive is mounted and writable.
2. The alias actually points to a **valid existing folder** (`/Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek Backup/Backup`).
3. You‚Äôre not running **Time Machine or other backup software** at the same time.
4. **AnyTrans has permissions** to access `/Volumes/Descent/...`

---

### üß™ Quick Test
To isolate the problem:
1. Unplug your phone
2. Open Finder or iTunes and **see if the iPhone appears** and loads data
3. Try a test backup with Finder or iTunes ‚Äî if that works, the issue is **specific to AnyTrans**

---

If this keeps happening, you can also **use iTunes/Finder to backup** now (just to get it done), and import that backup into AnyTrans later if needed.

Let me know if you want help checking the symlink setup again or want to do a direct terminal-based backup.
what other free backup managers that allow me to use a different folder to backup my phone ?

Here are **free (or freemium) iPhone backup managers** that let you choose a **custom backup folder**, unlike iTunes or Finder which force the default location:

---

### ‚úÖ **1. iMazing (Free Trial Mode)**
- **Custom backup location?** ‚úÖ Yes
- **Price**: Free trial lets you do full backups and restores (limited # of uses)
- **Bonus**: Encrypted backups, schedule automation, view individual app data
- **Link**: [imazing.com](https://imazing.com)

---

### ‚úÖ **2. iBackupBot (Free with limitations)**
- **Custom backup location?** ‚úÖ Yes, by pointing it to a folder with an existing iTunes-style backup
- **Price**: Free to use basic functions
- **Usage**: More for editing and managing backup contents
- **Note**: Doesn‚Äôt create new backups directly ‚Äî use iTunes or Finder first
- **Link**: [ibackupbot.com](http://www.icopybot.com/itunes-backup-manager.htm)

---

### ‚úÖ **3. iExplorer (Free version with limitations)**
- **Custom backup location?** ‚úÖ Yes, via settings
- **Price**: Free version has limited access; full features are paid
- **Best for**: Viewing and exporting backup data
- **Link**: [macroplant.com/iexplorer](https://macroplant.com/iexplorer)

---

### ‚úÖ **4. CopyTrans Shelbee (Windows Only)**
- **Custom backup location?** ‚úÖ Yes
- **Price**: Free for manual backups and restores
- **Bonus**: Also allows app-level backup
- **Link**: [copytrans.net](https://www.copytrans.net/copytransshelbee/)

---

### ‚úÖ **5. Terminal-Based Backup via iTunes + Symlink**  
You already started this! If the symlink is set up correctly (which it looks like it is), **Finder/iTunes** should use the external folder automatically. This is a clean, hack-free method that **requires no third-party apps** once set up.

---

### üö´ Not Recommended
- **3uTools** (Windows only, often flagged as bloatware)
- **Dr.Fone / Tenorshare / AnyUnlock** (aggressive marketing, expensive upsells)

---

### üß© Recommendation for Your Case:
Since you're on macOS and already symlinked the backup folder:
- **Just use Finder or iMazing**
- Or use terminal:  
  ```bash
  idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup
  ```

Let me know if you want to try a terminal-based backup or troubleshoot the symlink method.

(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ % idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup
zsh: command not found: idevicebackup2

You‚Äôre almost there ‚Äî that command uses a tool called `idevicebackup2`, which is part of the **libimobiledevice** suite. It‚Äôs not pre-installed on macOS, but you can add it via **Homebrew**:

---

### üõ†Ô∏è **Step-by-Step: Install `idevicebackup2` on macOS**

1. **Install Homebrew** (if you haven‚Äôt already):  
   ```bash
   /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"
   ```

2. **Install libimobiledevice**:
   ```bash
   brew install libimobiledevice
   ```

3. **Run your backup command again**:
   ```bash
   idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup
   ```

---

### ‚úÖ Bonus: Check iPhone is Detected

Before running backup, make sure macOS sees your device:

```bash
ideviceinfo
```

If your phone is **not trusted**, unlock it and tap **‚ÄúTrust this Computer‚Äù** again.

---

Let me know if you want to do a selective backup (e.g., no photos), or if you hit any error during the install.

Ah! That error means the `idevicebackup2` command-line tool isn‚Äôt installed yet. It‚Äôs part of **libimobiledevice**, a free, open-source suite for managing iOS devices via terminal.

Here‚Äôs how to get it working:

---

### ‚úÖ **Step-by-Step to Install `idevicebackup2` on macOS**

#### 1. **Install Homebrew** (if you haven‚Äôt already):
```bash
/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"
```

> If Homebrew is already installed, you can skip this step. Run `brew -v` to check.

---

#### 2. **Install libimobiledevice**:
```bash
brew install libimobiledevice
```

---

#### 3. **Check that it worked**:
```bash
idevicebackup2 --help
```

You should now see a help screen with usage instructions.

---

### ‚úÖ **Now, run your backup**:
```bash
idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup
```

If your iPhone is connected and unlocked, it should start backing up right into that folder ‚Äî no need for AnyTrans or Finder.

---

### üß† Optional Tip
You can list all connected iOS devices to confirm connection:
```bash
idevice_id -l
```

If it returns your device‚Äôs UDID, you‚Äôre good to go.

---

Let me know if you hit any errors or want to add encryption, skip system apps, etc. This tool is **powerful and lightweight** ‚Äî great for custom backup setups.

(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ % idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup

Backup directory is "/Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek Backup/Backup"
Started "com.apple.mobilebackup2" service on port 52159.
Could not perform backup protocol version exchange, error code -1
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ %

Ah, that error:

> **"Could not perform backup protocol version exchange, error code -1"**

means the backup tool (`idevicebackup2`) **couldn't establish proper communication** with the iPhone. This usually happens when:

---

### üîç **Root Causes & Fixes**

| Cause | Explanation | Fix |
|-------|-------------|-----|
| üîí **Device not trusted** | macOS needs you to "Trust" the computer on the iPhone | Unlock phone ‚Üí tap ‚ÄúTrust‚Äù ‚Üí enter passcode |
| üì± **iPhone is locked or asleep** | Locked screens prevent communication | Make sure screen is on, unlocked, and stays that way |
| ‚öôÔ∏è **Missing or incompatible pairing records** | `usbmuxd` isn‚Äôt managing the device properly | Run: `idevicepair unpair && idevicepair pair` |
| üß© **Mismatched libimobiledevice version** | New iOS versions sometimes break old tools | Try `brew reinstall libimobiledevice` and `brew install --HEAD libimobiledevice` |
| üßº **Stale USB session** | Old USBmuxd session needs a reset | Unplug ‚Üí Restart mac ‚Üí Plug back in and try again |

---

### ‚úÖ Step-by-step Fix
Try this sequence:

```bash
brew reinstall libimobiledevice
brew install --HEAD libimobiledevice
brew install usbmuxd
```

Then reset the pairing:

```bash
idevicepair unpair
idevicepair pair
```

(You'll need to unlock your phone and approve the pairing again.)

Now retry:

```bash
idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup
```

---

Let me know what it outputs after trying the pairing steps. We can also test the connection using:

```bash
ideviceinfo
```

If that fails too, it's definitely a connection issue between the Mac and the iPhone, not just the backup process.

(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ % idevicepair unpair && idevicepair pair
SUCCESS: Unpaired with device 00008130-0014192A0162001C
ERROR: Please accept the trust dialog on the screen of device 00008130-0014192A0162001C, then attempt to pair again.
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ % idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup

Backup directory is "/Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek Backup/Backup"
Started "com.apple.mobilebackup2" service on port 52178.
Could not perform backup protocol version exchange, error code -1
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ %

Great ‚Äî you're really close! You've successfully **unpaired**, but the key issue now is:

> **‚ÄúPlease accept the trust dialog on the screen...‚Äù**  
> And then:  
> **‚ÄúCould not perform backup protocol version exchange‚Äù**

This strongly indicates that the trust **was not accepted on the iPhone screen**.

---

### ‚úÖ Do This Step-by-Step:

1. **Unplug your iPhone**
2. **Lock then unlock the iPhone** to reset FaceID/passcode
3. **Plug the iPhone back in**
4. You should **see a ‚ÄúTrust this Computer?‚Äù prompt** on the iPhone screen
5. **Tap ‚ÄúTrust‚Äù** and **enter your passcode**
6. On Mac, now re-run:
   ```bash
   idevicepair pair
   ```

You should now get:
```bash
SUCCESS: Paired with device XXXXXXXX
```

Then finally run:
```bash
idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup
```

---

### üß† Pro Tip

To confirm you're really paired and trusted:
```bash
ideviceinfo
```
This will list device info if it‚Äôs properly paired.

If it still doesn‚Äôt work, try this one-liner to start fresh:
```bash
idevicepair unpair && killall usbmuxd && sleep 2 && usbmuxd -f -v
```
(then do the trust prompt + `idevicepair pair` again)

Let me know what `ideviceinfo` returns and whether the prompt ever shows up!

(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ %

Thanks for all that ‚Äî it's super helpful.

### ‚úÖ Here's What We Now Know:
- `ideviceinfo` **works perfectly** ‚Üí your iPhone **is connected, paired, and trusted**.
- But `idevicebackup2` still returns:
  > `Could not perform backup protocol version exchange, error code -1`

This error is a **known bug** when using `libimobiledevice` with **newer iOS versions (17.x and up)**. Your iPhone is on **iOS 17.1.1**, and the version from Homebrew is **not always fully compatible** with the current mobile backup protocol.

---

### üõ†Ô∏è Fix Options

#### ‚úÖ **Option A: Use the bleeding-edge version (if not already)**
Try forcing the latest development build from GitHub:
```bash
brew uninstall --ignore-dependencies libimobiledevice usbmuxd
brew install --HEAD usbmuxd
brew install --HEAD libimobiledevice
```

Then restart `usbmuxd`:
```bash
brew services restart usbmuxd
```

Then try the backup again:
```bash
idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup
```

> If you still get error `-1`, it‚Äôs likely a protocol incompatibility between your iOS version and the open-source tool.

---

#### ‚úÖ **Option B: Use iMazing (best working GUI)**
Since you're on macOS and just want the backup done ‚Äî **iMazing** is currently the most reliable tool:

- Download from: [https://imazing.com](https://imazing.com)
- Choose **custom backup folder** in Preferences
- You can do **manual backups** for free (automated or selective ones require a license)

It's the easiest no-hassle route right now.

---

#### ‚úÖ **Option C: Use Finder with Symlink (which you already set up)**

Since your symlink seems fine:
```bash
ls -l ~/Library/Application\ Support/MobileSync/Backup
```
You can simply open **Finder**, click your iPhone, and press **"Back Up Now"**.

It will write the backup to your external drive via the symlink. This is **100% free and works natively**, just slower and without selective restore options.

---

Would you like to verify the symlink again or go with iMazing for now?

Error: Invalid usage: Formula `libusbmuxd` has not implemented #plist, #service or installed a locatable service file
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ %

Perfect follow-up ‚Äî that error is actually expected! `usbmuxd` **doesn't support `brew services`** because it doesn‚Äôt run as a background service that way on macOS.

No worries though ‚Äî we can just **manually run** it or restart it using:

---

### ‚úÖ Manual Restart of `usbmuxd`
1. **Stop any existing usbmuxd instance:**
```bash
killall usbmuxd
```

2. **Start usbmuxd manually (foreground mode, with debug):**
```bash
usbmuxd -f -v
```

> It will now print debug info to your terminal ‚Äî leave this running in a tab.

---

### ‚úÖ Then in a **new terminal tab**:

Pair again (if needed):
```bash
idevicepair pair
```

Try backup:
```bash
idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup
```

---

### ‚úÖ What this does:
- Running `usbmuxd` manually bypasses some of the weird macOS permissions that can interfere with USB communication.
- You‚Äôll see logs appear in the terminal ‚Äî if it connects properly, you‚Äôll see service negotiation logs (instead of error `-1`).

---

Let me know what output you get when running `usbmuxd -f -v`, and whether the backup gets further now. If needed, I can help interpret the logs too.

(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ % idevicepair unpair && idevicepair pair                                
SUCCESS: Unpaired with device 00008130-0014192A0162001C
SUCCESS: Paired with device 00008130-0014192A0162001C
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ % idevicebackup2 backup /Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek\ Backup/Backup

Backup directory is "/Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek Backup/Backup"
Started "com.apple.mobilebackup2" service on port 52203.
Could not perform backup protocol version exchange, error code -1
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ %

Alright ‚Äî now that you're successfully **paired**, yet still hitting:

> `Could not perform backup protocol version exchange, error code -1`

‚Äî it confirms you're running into the well-documented **incompatibility between `libimobiledevice` and iOS 17+**.

---

### üîç Why It‚Äôs Happening
Apple made changes to the **mobilebackup2 protocol** in recent iOS versions (starting with iOS 16.6 and especially in 17.x), and `idevicebackup2` hasn‚Äôt fully caught up ‚Äî **even the `--HEAD` builds are unstable or unsupported for backups** on these versions.

---

### ‚úÖ Reliable Backup Alternatives for iOS 17+

Here‚Äôs what **does work today**:

#### ‚úÖ 1. **Use Finder + Your Symlinked External Drive**
Since your symlink is working:

```bash
ls -l ~/Library/Application\ Support/MobileSync/Backup
```

This should point to:
```
/Volumes/Descent/Bouzbek Backup/Backup
```

Now just:
- Open **Finder**
- Select your **iPhone**
- Choose **"Back Up Now"**

üí° It will write to the external drive thanks to the symlink ‚Äî no need for AnyTrans or `idevicebackup2`.

---

#### ‚úÖ 2. **Use iMazing (Free for Manual Backups)**
- Go to [iMazing.com](https://imazing.com)
- Set backup location to your external drive
- Click **‚ÄúBack Up‚Äù**

‚úîÔ∏è Free version allows manual full backups  
‚ùå Paid version needed for automation / specific data extraction

---

#### ‚úÖ 3. Wait for `libimobiledevice` Update (Not Immediate)
If you **really** want to use `idevicebackup2`, keep checking the GitHub repo:
https://github.com/libimobiledevice/libimobiledevice/issues

But right now, **even advanced builds fail** on iOS 17.1+

---

### üîö Recommendation
For now, I strongly recommend:
- **Finish the backup using Finder or iMazing**
- Treat `idevicebackup2` as a no-go for backups on iOS 17+ (until fixed upstream)

Want me to double-check that your symlink is functional and safe before using Finder? Or want a one-liner to verify space remaining on the external drive too?

Could not perform backup protocol version exchange, error code -1
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ % killall usbmuxd

No matching processes belonging to you were found
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ % usbmuxd -f -v

zsh: command not found: usbmuxd
(base) bilalghalib@Cruzer-2 ~ %
can i use the imazing backup with anytrans?

Great question ‚Äî here‚Äôs the deal:

---

### ‚ùì**Can iMazing backups be used with AnyTrans?**  
‚úÖ **Yes, but with limitations.**  
Both iMazing and AnyTrans create backups in **Apple's standard format**, stored in the same iTunes-compatible directory (usually at `~/Library/Application Support/MobileSync/Backup/`).

So **if you do a backup with iMazing**, and then open AnyTrans:

- It **should detect the backup**, especially if it‚Äôs stored in the default (or symlinked) location.
- You can **browse, extract**, or **manage content** from that backup in AnyTrans.

---

### ‚ö†Ô∏è What You *Can‚Äôt* Do:
